data.scheme_name: MSME Innovative Scheme  - IPR Component  - Awareness & Training Activities
data.benefits: Scheme provides benefit for spreading awareness through webinar and physical training ranging from Rs. 40000 to 3 lakhs per day.
data.eligibility: All MSMEs having Udyam Registration Certificate are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions: Applicant has to submit a self-declaration for not claiming funding from any Central/State Government for the same patent/trademark/design.
data.beneficiaries: Government Bodies/Departments /Autonomous Organizations being Run on Autonomous or Commercial Lines, MSME Industry Associations, Societies/ Cooperatives / Firms/Trust and Other profit and non-profit Bodies, NGOs representing or working for MSMEs, Research/ Technical & Educational Institutions, Universities/ colleges with a track record of assisting MSMEs etc.
data.prerequisites:
1. The financial assistance is only for organizational expenses of the proposed event and not for capital items, such as construction, equipment, automation, etc. 

2. The organization receiving the grant shall have to give an undertaking that no grant-in-aid has been received from any other authorities of the Central or State Governments and that a grant-in-aid for the same purpose has not been applied for by the organization to any of those authorities. 

3. The organization shall have to give an undertaking that the grant shall be utilized for the purpose it is sanctioned. In case of failure to do so the whole amount shall be refunded to the Government in full with such interest thereon as the Central Government may decide. 

4. Share of private partners shall be at least 10% of the total Government financial support given for organizing the event.
data.context: This scheme is introduced to promote a culture of innovation and creative problem solving through knowledge sharing and collaboration amongst industry.
data.objective: The aim is to enhance the awareness of Intellectual Property Rights (IPRs) amongst the MSMEs and to encourage creative intellectual endeavour in Indian economy.
data.description:
1. For awareness programme - Government of India will provide Financial Support for organizing the sensitization/awareness one day programme. (Minimum 30 participants.) Webinar: Rs. 40,000/ - Physical: Rs. 70,000/- 

2. The Government of India may provide financial support for Multi-day Workshops (Maximum 5 Days) (Minimum 50 participants, for Physical training: Rs. 5 Lakh per day (May be prorated).

3. The Government of India may provide financial support for 5-Day training programme 20-25 participants per training - Virtual: Rs. 60,000/ - per day Physical: Rs. 3 Lakh per day (May be prorated).
data.funding_facilitator: Development Commissioner (DC), Ministry Of Micro, Small And Medium Enterprises
data.funding_mechanism: Reimbursements process will be initiated after the acceptance of Application and payment will be made directly to the beneficiary.
data.additional_info:
• The financial assistance under this component will be available to those who have not availed any Central/State Government subsidy for the same purpose. 
  • The MSME Innovative scheme is designed by integrating three components of CLCSTUS (viz., Incubation, Design & IPR) schemes to create CHAMPIONS, where each component can have interoperability with other components during the phases of intervention to enhance capacities/capabilities of champion MSMEs. 
  • MSME can have opportunity to suitably interlink benefits among three components during the period/stage of implementation. 
  1. There are some options of various combinations like- 
    Only Incubation OR Only Design OR Only IPR 
  2. Incubation-Design-IPR 
  3. Incubation-Design 
  4. Incubation to IPR 
  5. Design-IPR MSME can apply for any one of the above combinations. 
  • The financial assistance will be applicable for availing the benefits as per the individual scheme component. 
  • One scheme may enter from one completed gate to the gate of another scheme as per the requirement of the MSME, while ensuring that the original scheme it enrolled for is taken to the natural conclusion. 
  • At the time of applying for the next scheme, the applicant should adhere to the respective scheme guidelines for that particular scheme.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. University affiliation       
2. Udyam Registration Certificate 
2. AICTE approval letter/Certificate      
3. Other/NABL accreditation       
4. Last 2 years, audited annual accounts with the auditorâ€™s report 
5. Proof of No. of students enrolled during previous two years  
6. Audited financial statements of Business incubators (B.I.)
